Hadleigh Library

Manager: Sarah Hunt

29 High Street, Hadleigh
IP7 5AG

  • Tel: 01473 823778
  • Email: help@suffolklibraries.co.uk
  • Friends group: Hadleigh Library Friends
  • Facebook
  • Twitter

Opening hours

Day Hours
Monday Closed
Tuesday 0900 – 1700
Wednesday 0900 – 1700
Thursday 0900 – 1800
Friday 0900 – 1700
Saturday 0930 – 1700
Sunday 1000 – 1600

Room & venue hire

Room and space hire at Hadleigh Library →

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: available for blue badge holders only
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Customer toilet
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Photocopying: available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Scan to email
  • Fax
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Baby Bounce

Thursday, 1000-1030

Soothing songs and gentle nursery rhymes for babies.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Craft activities: for primary school age children

Sunday, 1030-1430

Storytime

Wednesday, 1000-1030

Suitable for 2+ year-olds. Term-time only.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Tot Rock

Friday, 1000-1030

Songs and action rhymes for toddlers.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Older people's events

U3A Looking at Art group

fourth Monday of the month, 1430

For more details please call Polly Shearly-Sanders on 01473 829601.

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Wednesday, 1030-1230

IT help

Computer basics: book in advance

Thursday, 1515-1615

Including help with visiting websites, using email and accessing the Suffolk Libraries catalogue and eLibrary services.

IT buddy: book in advance

Wednesday, 1000-1100

Get help using your computer or iPad.

Arts, crafts & games

Art in the Afternoon: Hadleigh art club

Tuesday (runs from September to May), 1400-1600

For more information call Bryan Haylock on 01473 827752 or 01473 827211.

Health & wellbeing events

Suffolk Bereavement Support

2nd and 4th Thursday of the month, 1330-1530

See http://www.suffolkbereavement.org.uk for more details and to reserve a free place please call Patrick or Margaret on 01206 299832.

Councillor surgeries & professional advice

Babergh District Council mobile customer access point

Thursday, 1330-1700

Drop in for council services.
